---
title: "2 List Strategy, First Things First, Multi-Tasking, & More"
date: 2025-07-02
draft: false
---

<p id="">Welcome to the <strong id="">300(!)</strong> new friends of the Mental Models, Concepts, and Frameworks newsletter who have joined us since last week!</p><h1 id="">This Week: 10 more of the best prioritization mental models I've found</h1><h2 id="">Calendar-Priority Alignment</h2><p id="">1. “What are your priorities?”</p><p id="">2. “If I look at your calendar, would it be obvious to me that those are your priorities?”</p><p id="">Hack: Use your Calendar as your to-do list so that your highest priority to-dos actually get done.</p><p id="">h/t <a href="https://flight.beehiiv.net/v2/clicks/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..KSSEen4cEhbnGboyFHFx9SmWh9qx-KO_SkBZcjKoaKw" target="_blank" id="">@rabois</a></p><h2 id="">Warren Buffett - 2 List Strategy</h2><p id="">Steps:</p><ol id=""><li id="">Write down your top 25 goals </li><li id="">Circle your top 5 goals on that list</li><li id="">Place any goal that you didn’t circle on the “avoid at all costs” list—these are the tasks that aren’t important enough to move you towards your long-term goals</li></ol><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa62d43efd4aad748826_image.png" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">First Things First</h2><p id="">Prioritize Q2—Effectiveness.</p><p id="">“Putting first things first means organizing and executing on your most important priorities.</p><p id="">It is living and being driven by the principles you value most, not by the agendas and forces surrounding you.”</p><p id="">— Stephen Covey</p><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa62e91bccb6439ce4e7_image.png" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">Multi-Tasking</h2><p id="">”You can’t ignore your finiteness by working your way through it (Multi-Tasking).</p><p id="">You must pause and think about what you’re doing, and whether it’s actually worth doing.</p><p id="">Only then can you experience the true fruits of existence.”</p><p id="">h/t <a href="https://flight.beehiiv.net/v2/clicks/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Fk6vevMMgtKujSXVxYSmVZ3fXRxODw2C0SnvvHfkrC0" target="_blank" id="">@moretothat</a></p><h2 id="">Total Addressable Market (TAM)</h2><p id="">A TAM is an estimate of the potential revenue available for a product or service—it helps startups prioritize what to build.</p><p id="">Here, we use it as a metaphor to represent the idea that we should prioritize the biggest opportunities available to us.</p><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa62cfbab516c09c2d33_image.jpeg" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">Pareto Principle</h2><p id="">20% of your effort will lead to 80% of your results.</p><p id="">Some inputs are vital, some are minimal.</p><p id="">To maximize positive ROI, prioritize the 20%.</p><p id="">For example, 20% of clients provide you with 80% of your profits—these should be prioritized.</p><h2 id="">RICE Score</h2><p id="">(R): How much Reach could the project have?</p><p id="">(I): How much positive Impact if it succeeded?</p><p id="">(C): What is the Confidence that it succeeds?</p><p id="">(E): How much Effort is required to complete the project?</p><p id="">Prioritize the highest scoring project(s).</p><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa623bcc716f00a7ca8f_image.png" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">The Productivity Pyramid</h2><p id="">A simple tool to help keep you on course to reach your biggest goals.</p><p id="">Your values inspire your long-term and short-term goals, which govern what you should do today.</p><p id="">Steps:</p><ol id=""><li id="">Governing Values</li><li id="">Long-Term Goals</li><li id="">Short-Term Goals</li><li id="">Daily Tasks</li></ol><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa624aa3ecb509402927_image.jpeg" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">Critical Path Analysis</h2><p id="">A method to plan what needs to be done and when to complete a project in the shortest time possible.</p><p id="">Steps:</p><ol id=""><li id="">List tasks required to complete your project</li><li id="">List dependencies between your task</li><li id="">Estimate the time each activity will take to complete</li></ol><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-image w-richtext-align-center" data-rt-type="image" data-rt-align="center"><div><img src="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/63fd511e232de229bfe66c52/640faa623bcc711ff6a7ca90_image.png" id="" width="auto" height="auto" loading="auto"></div></figure><h2 id="">LNO Framework</h2><p id="">Types of tasks:</p><p id="">Leverage (~10x): "Do a great job. Let your inner perfectionist shine."</p><p id="">Neutral (~1x): "Do a strictly good job. No better."</p><p id="">Overhead (~&lt;1x): "Just get it done. Actively try to do a bad job."</p><p id="">h/t <a href="https://flight.beehiiv.net/v2/clicks/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Us2uc6_IwisSIF8fB3tGtsiPphuPf7HTsCmjrtRAxMw" target="_blank" id="">@shreyas</a></p><figure class="w-richtext-figure-type-video w-richtext-align-center" style="padding-bottom:33.75%" data-rt-type="video" data-rt-align="center" data-rt-max-width="" data-rt-max-height="33.75%" data-rt-dimensions="0:0" data-page-url=""><div><iframe scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true" src="https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=false&embedId=twitter-widget-0&%3D&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1223816226918453253&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Falexbrogan.beehiiv.com%2Fp%2F10-best-prioritization-mental-models-ive-found-ade2&sessionId=a0eba96c6b760aaef32be4d7ddc6fc1804bee613&theme=light&widgetsVersion=aaf4084522e3a%3A1674595607486&width=550px"></iframe></div></figure><h2 id="">That's it, I hope you enjoyed reading!</h2><p>‍</p>
